meanings.definition: To force upon or impose something on someone else.
meanings.sent1: The teacher foisted extra homework on the students.
meanings.sent2: He foisted his opinion on others without asking for theirs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf foisted a fake treasure map on the unsuspecting adventurers.
meanings.sent4: She foisted her responsibilities onto her colleague, hoping to avoid them.
meanings.sent5: The salesman foisted unnecessary products on the customer, taking advantage of their trust.

meanings.definition: To pass off as genuine or valuable.
meanings.sent1: The con artist foisted a counterfeit painting on the art collector.
meanings.sent2: She tried to foist her old phone on me as a brand-new model.
meanings.sent3: The magician foisted a rubber rabbit as a real one, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: He foisted his outdated ideas as cutting-edge concepts, but no one was fooled.
meanings.sent5: The forger foisted fake documents on the unsuspecting victims, causing chaos in the community.
